snippet: Since 2005, a pedestrian crossing has drawn a surge of Slovakian visitors to a small Ukrainian village, where consumer goods are considerably cheaper.
abstract: Mali Selmentsi Journal; village of Mali Selmentsi, Ukraine, is shopping destination for Slovakians who live just across border and are eager to take advantage of cheap consumer goods in Ukraine due to inflation; border was rigidly guarded in Soviet era, but since its opening in 2005, Mali Selmentsi has boomed to accommodate steady stream of Slovak shoppers.

byline.contributor: Miroslava Germanova contributed reporting from Velke Slemence, Slovakia.

lead_paragraph: Since 2005, a pedestrian crossing has drawn a surge of Slovakian visitors to a small Ukrainian village, where consumer goods are considerably cheaper.

headline.print_headline: Once Fenced by Soviets, Border Town Is Now Shopper’s Paradise
headline.main: A Ukrainian Border Town Once Fenced by Soviets Blossoms Into a Shopper’s Paradise
